name: Big Springs
description: Expect a brutal 10.5 mile round trip hike with 4.5 miles of river walking and deep water; it is the top of the bottom-up route in the Narrows.
tips: Expect a brutal 10.5 mile round trip hike with 4.5 miles of river walking and deep water; it is the top of the bottom-up route in the Narrows.

name: West Temple
description: One of the few peaks that catches the absolute first light of the morning.
tips: One of the few peaks that catches the absolute first light of the morning.

name: East Temple
description: A unique location that catches direct light at both the beginning and the end of the day.
tips: A unique location that catches direct light at both the beginning and the end of the day.

name: The Watchman
description: The tip catches sunrise light while the face catches sunset light; beginner-friendly compositions are available via the Watchman Trail.
tips: The tip catches sunrise light while the face catches sunset light; beginner-friendly compositions are available via the Watchman Trail.

name: Bridge Mountain
description: Catches direct light at sunset; the backside can also catch light during sunrise.
tips: Catches direct light at sunset; the backside can also catch light during sunrise.

name: Court of the Patriarchs
description: Does not catch the absolute first light, but glows shortly after the initial sunrise.
tips: Does not catch the absolute first light, but glows shortly after the initial sunrise.

name: Mt. Kinesava
description: Located near the south entrance of the park, this peak is one of the primary features to catch late-day light.
tips: Located near the south entrance of the park, this peak is one of the primary features to catch late-day light.

name: Pa'rus Trail
description: Ideal for beginners as the compositions are less chaotic near the mouth of the canyon compared to deeper sections.
tips: Ideal for beginners as the compositions are less chaotic near the mouth of the canyon compared to deeper sections.

name: The Narrows
description: The driest month is best for deep canyons; focus on working with bounce light and the details of the canyon walls.
tips: The driest month is best for deep canyons; focus on working with bounce light and the details of the canyon walls.

name: Great White Throne
description: Look for maple trees at the bottom of the canyon to frame the illuminated white peak for a classic Zion composition.
tips: Look for maple trees at the bottom of the canyon to frame the illuminated white peak for a classic Zion composition.
